doc.title: Kanine Aristocrats
doc.plot: An entry in Universal's "Person-Oddities" series of Shorts, similar in theme and style to Paramount's "Unusual Occupations." In the one. Mrs.Ida McGuire of Napanee, Ontario, Canada is bequeathed $100,000 to take care of 25 dogs. The title of these shorts was always connected to the lead story. From there it jumps to the Nevada State Prison where prisoners are rehabilitated through hobbies; to Portland, Oregon where a Pullman Conductor named Robert Allen repairs clocks as a hobby; on to Chicago, Illinois to find school teacher Eugene Kane building boats in his back yard and, finally, to Dallas, Texas where 14-year-old Bobby May stands on his hands everwhere. Because he can is evidently why since the Guinness World Book of records wasn't around yet.
